bibl.title: Priests, Tongues, and Rites. The London-Leiden Magical Manuscripts and Translation in Egyptian Ritual (100-300 CE). (Religions in the Graeco-Roman World. 153.)
bibl.note: Diss. Leiden Univ., 2003. - I. Introduction. - II. Presentation of the Sources: P. Leid. Inv. I 384 verso [= P.G.M. II, xii; P.D.M XII] and P. London-Leiden [P. Lond. Inv. 10070 + P. Leid. Inv. I 383 = P.D.M. XIV; P.G.M. II, xiv]. - III. The Use of Script. - IV. The Form and Function of Bilingualism. - V. Diversity in Rhetoric. - VI. Of Priests and Prestige. The Need for an Authoritative Tradition. - VII. Towards a Model of Textual Transmission. - Appendices. - Bibliography. Index of Passages. Index of Subjects.
